description: Parents warned parents to think twice about buying an e-bike for an underage child for Christmas.
title: ‘Electric Bikes Are Not Toys’: Parents Fined After Kids Caught Riding Electric Motorbikes

description: Prominent restauranteur Alan Yazbek pleaded guilty to displaying the Nazi symbol, but the magistrate accepted his 'regret.'

description: Quebec Superior Court has approved a class action settlement that could provide as much as $10.25 million to victims who were sexually abused by a minor hockey coach in a Montreal suburb. François Lamarre, a former Montreal police officer who retired in 1994 and died in 2020, was a boys hockey coach in Greenfield Park […]
title: Quebec Court Greenlights Class-Action Settlement for Alleged Victims of Deceased Minor Hockey Coach

description: A team of scientists have attributed a good nights rest as key for enhancing language learning.

description: Deputy Prime Minister and Racing Minister Winston Peters had backed greyhound racing months ago.
title: New Zealand to Ban Greyhound Racing From 2026

description: Flair Airlines’ chief financial officer Sumanth Rao is facing involuntary manslaughter charges in connection with a fatal crash involving an underage driver who had been drinking at his Atlanta-area home. Flair said in an emailed statement it was aware of the situation and had put measures in place “to ensure operational continuity” as the court […]
title: Flair Airlines CFO Faces Manslaughter Charges Linked to Fatal Car Crash in US

description: The IDF moved to secure Israel's demilitarized zone with Syria and conducted more than 300 airstrikes to destroy Damascus's weapons and bases.
title: Syria’s Volatile Situation Poses Many Questions for Israel

description: A Brantford, Ont., police officer was treated for fentanyl exposure after being bitten by a woman who was attempting to ingest the drug during her arrest. Officers were dispatched to an intersection in the city Dec. 3 after receiving a report that a woman had allegedly fled the scene of a one-vehicle crash carrying a […]
title: Ontario Police Officer Exposed to Fentanyl After Being Bitten While Trying to Save Suspect’s Life

description: Canada’s privacy commissioner says LinkedIn has paused training its artificial intelligence models on data from Canadian users. Philippe Dufresne says his office was informed of the pause by the tech platform, which he had reached out to after media reports suggested LinkedIn was training AI models with data from Canadian users it had not informed […]
title: LinkedIn Pauses AI Training Using Canadian User Data: Privacy Commissioner

description: Canada has sanctioned eight senior Chinese officials for “grave human rights violations” against Falun Gong practitioners, Tibetans, and Uyghurs. “Canada is deeply concerned by the human rights violations in Xinjiang and Tibet and against those who practise Falun Gong,” Foreign Affairs Minister Mélanie Joly said in a Dec. 10 press release. “We call on the […]
title: Canada Sanctions Chinese Officials for Oppressing Falun Gong, Ethnic Minorities

description: Lawmakers and human rights advocates call for countermeasures in light of Beijing's campaign to manipulate Western democratic systems to attack Falun Gong.

description: Canadians diagnosed with cancer and their caregivers bear an average of $32,778 in cancer-related costs over the patient’s lifetime, a new report suggests. Those costs include out-of-pocket expenses, time costs, and lost income due to unemployment. The rising incidence of cancer among Canadians not only contributes to higher costs for the health-care system, it also […]
title: Canadians With Cancer and Their Caregivers Face Nearly $33K in Lifetime Medical Costs: Report

description: NTD’s Lee Hall sits down with James Bartholomew, author, journalist, and director of the Museum of Communist Terror. Bartholomew says Britain’s education system is failing children by not teaching them the horrors of communism, which has taken more than 80 million lives.
title: It’s a Major Failing That the Horrors of Communism Are Not Taught in Schools: James Bartholomew

description: Washington is deeply concerned by China's 'restrictions on fundamental freedoms and its use of transnational repression,' says U.S. ambassador to China.

description: B.C. Conservative leader John Rustad said he supports the former vice-chair of the Vancouver Police Board who was recently forced to step down following comments she posted on social media. description: NEW DELHI—Senior U.S. diplomat Donald Lu traveled to South Asia from Dec. 3 to Dec. 10, visiting India, Sri Lanka, and Nepal. description: India had also placed orders with Boeing last year, which President Joe Biden said had the potential to support over a million American jobs in 44 states.

description: Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland has yet to disclose whether her upcoming mini-budget will adhere to the guideline she set last year to prevent a deficit increase. title: Freeland Mum on Deficit Fiscal Guardrail Ahead of Mini-Budget

description: Fifteen charges under the federal Fisheries Act have been laid against Imperial Metals Corp. more than a decade after a tailings pond collapsed the Mount Polley mine, spilling more than 20 million cubic metres of waste water into B.C. description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has again commented on Canada’s sovereignty, saying he’s eager for another meeting with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, whom he referred to as a state “governor.” The remark is an apparent reference to Trump’s recent quip that Canada could become the 51st U.S. state, and Trudeau the governor. “It was a pleasure […]

description: While the crime severity index has risen nationally in recent years, the rise in rural areas has outpaced that of Canada’s big cities, challenging small police forces to tackle bigger issues than they have in the past. description: Federal officials say copper wire theft is on the rise in Canada, but it’s difficult to combat because the infrastructure usually lacks basic security and its identifiers can be easily erased. description: Commentary After decades on the outs with environmentalists and regulators, nuclear power is being heralded as a key component for a “net zero” future of clean, reliable energy. description: Thames Water reported a 40 percent rise in sewage pollution to 359 incidents in the six months to September.
